definition: Returns employee names converted to uppercase. (UPPER String Function)
Returns employee names in lowercase. (LOWER String Function)
Returns the number of characters in each employee's name. (LENGTH String Function)
Returns full names by concatenating first and last names. (CONCAT Function)
Removes leading and trailing spaces from a string. (TRIM Function)
Rounds salary values to 2 decimal places. (ROUND Numeric Function)
Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to the number. (CEIL Function)
Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the number. (FLOOR Function)
Returns the remainder of 10 divided by 3. (MOD Function)
Returns the absolute (positive) value. (ABS Function)
Returns 2 raised to the power of 3. (POWER Function)
Returns the square root of 25. (SQRT Function)
Returns the current date and time. (NOW Date Function)
Returns the current date. (CURRENT_DATE Function)

term: SELECT EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) FROM employees;
definition: Extracts the year from the hire_date column. (EXTRACT Function)
Returns the number of days between now and hire date. (DATEDIFF Function)

term: SELECT DATE_ADD(hire_date, INTERVAL 30 DAY) FROM employees;
definition: Adds 30 days to the hire_date. (DATE_ADD Function)

term: SELECT DATE_SUB(hire_date, INTERVAL 7 DAY) FROM employees;
definition: Subtracts 7 days from hire_date. (DATE_SUB Function)
Returns the first non-null value among arguments. (COALESCE Function)
Replaces NULL salary values with 0. (ISNULL Function)
Returns the average salary. (AVG Aggregate Function)
Returns the total salary of all employees. (SUM Aggregate Function)
Returns the minimum salary. (MIN Aggregate Function)
Returns the maximum salary. (MAX Aggregate Function)
Returns the total number of employees. (COUNT Aggregate Function)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
definition: Returns names of employees earning more than 50000. (Greater Than Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary < 30000;
definition: Returns employees earning less than 30000. (Less Than Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary >= 40000;
definition: Returns employees with salary greater than or equal to 40000. (Greater Than or Equal Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary <= 60000;
definition: Returns employees with salary less than or equal to 60000. (Less Than or Equal Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE dept_id = 2;
definition: Returns employees from department 2. (Equals Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE dept_id != 3;
definition: Returns employees not in department 3. (!= Not Equal Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE name LIKE 'A%';
definition: Returns employees whose names start with 'A'. (LIKE Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE name NOT LIKE '%son';
definition: Returns employees whose names do not end with 'son'. (NOT LIKE Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary BETWEEN 30000 AND 50000;
definition: Returns employees with salary in the specified range. (BETWEEN Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE dept_id IN (1, 2, 3);
definition: Returns employees from departments 1, 2, or 3. (IN Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE dept_id NOT IN (4, 5);
definition: Returns employees not in departments 4 or 5. (NOT IN Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary IS NULL;
definition: Returns employees whose salary is unknown (NULL). (IS NULL Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary IS NOT NULL;
definition: Returns employees with a known salary value. (IS NOT NULL Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE NOT (salary > 60000);
definition: Returns employees with salary not greater than 60000. (NOT Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary > 40000 AND dept_id = 2;
definition: Returns employees from department 2 earning more than 40000. (AND Operator)

term: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE dept_id = 1 OR dept_id = 3;
definition: Returns employees from either department 1 or 3. (OR Operator)
Returns unique department IDs from employees table. (DISTINCT Keyword)

term: SELECT name FROM employees ORDER BY salary ASC;
definition: Returns employee names sorted by ascending salary. (ORDER BY ASC)

term: SELECT name FROM employees ORDER BY salary DESC;
definition: Returns employee names sorted by descending salary. (ORDER BY DESC)

term: SELECT name, salary * 12 AS annual_salary FROM employees;
definition: Returns annual salary by multiplying monthly salary by 12. (Arithmetic Operator)
Returns the first 5 employees. (LIMIT Clause)
Skips the first 5 records and returns the rest. (OFFSET Clause)

term: SELECT name FROM employees LIMIT 5 OFFSET 10;
definition: Skips 10 records and returns the next 5. (LIMIT + OFFSET)
